00094 #define TIMEOUT(f, a, t)    sys_untimeout((f), (a)), sys_timeout((t)*1000, (f), (a))

00098 # ifndef __u_char_defined
00099 
00100 /* Type definitions for BSD code. */
00101 typedef unsigned long u_long;
00102 typedef unsigned int u_int;
00103 typedef unsigned short u_short;
00104 typedef unsigned char u_char;
00105 
00106 #endif
00107 
00108 /*
00109  * Constants and structures defined by the internet system,
00110  * Per RFC 790, September 1981, and numerous additions.
00111  */
00112 
00113 /*
00114  * The basic PPP frame.
00115  */
00116 #define PPP_HDRLEN  4       /* octets for standard ppp header */
00117 #define PPP_FCSLEN  2       /* octets for FCS */
00118 
00119 
00120 /*
00121  * Significant octet values.
00122  */
00123 #define PPP_ALLSTATIONS 0xff    /* All-Stations broadcast address */
00124 #define PPP_UI          0x03    /* Unnumbered Information */
00125 #define PPP_FLAG        0x7e    /* Flag Sequence */
00126 #define PPP_ESCAPE      0x7d    /* Asynchronous Control Escape */
00127 #define PPP_TRANS       0x20    /* Asynchronous transparency modifier */
00128 
00129 /*
00130  * Protocol field values.
00131  */
00132 #define PPP_IP          0x21    /* Internet Protocol */
00133 #define PPP_AT          0x29    /* AppleTalk Protocol */
00134 #define PPP_VJC_COMP    0x2d    /* VJ compressed TCP */
00135 #define PPP_VJC_UNCOMP  0x2f    /* VJ uncompressed TCP */
00136 #define PPP_COMP        0xfd    /* compressed packet */
00137 #define PPP_IPCP        0x8021  /* IP Control Protocol */
00138 #define PPP_ATCP        0x8029  /* AppleTalk Control Protocol */
00139 #define PPP_CCP         0x80fd  /* Compression Control Protocol */
00140 #define PPP_LCP         0xc021  /* Link Control Protocol */
00141 #define PPP_PAP         0xc023  /* Password Authentication Protocol */
00142 #define PPP_LQR         0xc025  /* Link Quality Report protocol */
00143 #define PPP_CHAP        0xc223  /* Cryptographic Handshake Auth. Protocol */
00144 #define PPP_CBCP        0xc029  /* Callback Control Protocol */
00145 
00146 /*
00147  * Values for FCS calculations.
00148  */
00149 #define PPP_INITFCS 0xffff  /* Initial FCS value */
00150 #define PPP_GOODFCS 0xf0b8  /* Good final FCS value */
00151 #define PPP_FCS(fcs, c) (((fcs) >> 8) ^ fcstab[((fcs) ^ (c)) & 0xff])
00152 
00153 /*
00154  * Extended asyncmap - allows any character to be escaped.
00155  */
00156 typedef u_char  ext_accm[32];
00157 
00158 /*
00159  * What to do with network protocol (NP) packets.
00160  */
00161 enum NPmode {
00162     NPMODE_PASS,        /* pass the packet through */
00163     NPMODE_DROP,        /* silently drop the packet */
00164     NPMODE_ERROR,       /* return an error */
00165     NPMODE_QUEUE        /* save it up for later. */
00166 };
00167 
00168 /*
00169  * Inline versions of get/put char/short/long.
00170  * Pointer is advanced; we assume that both arguments
00171  * are lvalues and will already be in registers.
00172  * cp MUST be u_char *.
00173  */
00174 #define GETCHAR(c, cp) { \
00175     (c) = *(cp)++; \
00176 }
00177 #define PUTCHAR(c, cp) { \
00178     *(cp)++ = (u_char) (c); \
00179 }
00180 
00181 
00182 #define GETSHORT(s, cp) { \
00183     (s) = *(cp)++ << 8; \
00184     (s) |= *(cp)++; \
00185 }
00186 #define PUTSHORT(s, cp) { \
00187     *(cp)++ = (u_char) ((s) >> 8); \
00188     *(cp)++ = (u_char) (s); \
00189 }
00190 
00191 #define GETLONG(l, cp) { \
00192     (l) = *(cp)++ << 8; \
00193     (l) |= *(cp)++; (l) <<= 8; \
00194     (l) |= *(cp)++; (l) <<= 8; \
00195     (l) |= *(cp)++; \
00196 }
00197 #define PUTLONG(l, cp) { \
00198     *(cp)++ = (u_char) ((l) >> 24); \
00199     *(cp)++ = (u_char) ((l) >> 16); \
00200     *(cp)++ = (u_char) ((l) >> 8); \
00201     *(cp)++ = (u_char) (l); \
00202 }
00203 
00204 
00205 #define INCPTR(n, cp)   ((cp) += (n))
00206 #define DECPTR(n, cp)   ((cp) -= (n))
00207 
00208 #define BCMP(s0, s1, l)     memcmp((u_char *)(s0), (u_char *)(s1), (l))
00209 #define BCOPY(s, d, l)      memcpy((d), (s), (l))
00210 #define BZERO(s, n)         memset(s, 0, n)
00211 
00212 #define PRINTMSG(m, l)  { m[l] = '\0'; ppp_trace(LOG_INFO, "Remote message: %s\n", m); }
00213 
00214 /*
00215  * MAKEHEADER - Add PPP Header fields to a packet.
00216  */
00217 #define MAKEHEADER(p, t) { \
00218     PUTCHAR(PPP_ALLSTATIONS, p); \
00219     PUTCHAR(PPP_UI, p); \
00220     PUTSHORT(t, p); }
00221 
00222 /*************************
00223 *** PUBLIC DEFINITIONS ***
00224 *************************/
00225 
00226 /* Error codes. */
00227 #define PPPERR_NONE 0                           /* No error. */
00228 #define PPPERR_PARAM -1                         /* Invalid parameter. */
00229 #define PPPERR_OPEN -2                          /* Unable to open PPP session. */
00230 #define PPPERR_DEVICE -3                        /* Invalid I/O device for PPP. */
00231 #define PPPERR_ALLOC -4                         /* Unable to allocate resources. */
00232 #define PPPERR_USER -5                          /* User interrupt. */
00233 #define PPPERR_CONNECT -6                       /* Connection lost. */
00234 #define PPPERR_AUTHFAIL -7                      /* Failed authentication challenge. */
00235 #define PPPERR_PROTOCOL -8                      /* Failed to meet protocol. */
00236 
00237 /*
00238  * PPP IOCTL commands.
00239  */
00240 /*
00241  * Get the up status - 0 for down, non-zero for up.  The argument must
00242  * point to an int.
00243  */
00244 #define PPPCTLG_UPSTATUS 100    /* Get the up status - 0 down else up */
00245 #define PPPCTLS_ERRCODE 101             /* Set the error code */
00246 #define PPPCTLG_ERRCODE 102             /* Get the error code */
00247 #define PPPCTLG_FD              103             /* Get the fd associated with the ppp */
00248 
00249 /************************
00250 *** PUBLIC DATA TYPES ***
00251 ************************/
00252 
00253 /*
00254  * The following struct gives the addresses of procedures to call
00255  * for a particular protocol.
00256  */
00257 struct protent {
00258     u_short protocol;       /* PPP protocol number */
00259     /* Initialization procedure */
00260     void (*init) (int unit);
00261     /* Process a received packet */
00262     void (*input) (int unit, u_char *pkt, int len);
00263     /* Process a received protocol-reject */
00264     void (*protrej) (int unit);
00265     /* Lower layer has come up */
00266     void (*lowerup) (int unit);
00267     /* Lower layer has gone down */
00268     void (*lowerdown) (int unit);
00269     /* Open the protocol */
00270     void (*open) (int unit);
00271     /* Close the protocol */
00272     void (*close) (int unit, char *reason);
00273 #if 0
00274     /* Print a packet in readable form */
00275     int  (*printpkt) (u_char *pkt, int len,
00276               void (*printer) (void *, char *, ...),
00277               void *arg);
00278     /* Process a received data packet */
00279     void (*datainput) (int unit, u_char *pkt, int len);
00280 #endif
00281     int  enabled_flag;      /* 0 iff protocol is disabled */
00282     char *name;         /* Text name of protocol */
00283 #if 0
00284     /* Check requested options, assign defaults */
00285     void (*check_options) (u_long);
00286     /* Configure interface for demand-dial */
00287     int  (*demand_conf) (int unit);
00288     /* Say whether to bring up link for this pkt */
00289     int  (*active_pkt) (u_char *pkt, int len);
00290 #endif
00291 };
00292 
00293 /*
00294  * The following structure records the time in seconds since
00295  * the last NP packet was sent or received.
00296  */
00297 struct ppp_idle {
00298     u_short xmit_idle;      /* seconds since last NP packet sent */
00299     u_short recv_idle;      /* seconds since last NP packet received */
00300 };
00301 
00302 struct ppp_settings {
00303 
00304         u_int  disable_defaultip : 1;   /* Don't use hostname for default IP addrs */
00305         u_int  auth_required : 1;      /* Peer is required to authenticate */
00306         u_int  explicit_remote : 1;    /* remote_name specified with remotename opt */
00307         u_int  refuse_pap : 1;         /* Don't wanna auth. ourselves with PAP */
00308         u_int  refuse_chap : 1;        /* Don't wanna auth. ourselves with CHAP */
00309         u_int  usehostname : 1;        /* Use hostname for our_name */
00310         u_int  usepeerdns : 1;         /* Ask peer for DNS adds */
00311 
00312         u_short idle_time_limit; /* Shut down link if idle for this long */
00313         int  maxconnect;         /* Maximum connect time (seconds) */
00314 
00315         char user[MAXNAMELEN + 1];/* Username for PAP */
00316         char passwd[MAXNAMELEN + 1];           /* Password for PAP */
00317         char our_name[MAXNAMELEN + 1];         /* Our name for authentication purposes */
00318         char remote_name[MAXNAMELEN + 1];      /* Peer's name for authentication */
00319 };
00320 
00321 struct ppp_addrs {
00322     struct ip_addr our_ipaddr, his_ipaddr, netmask, dns1, dns2;
00323 };
00324 
00325 /*****************************
00326 *** PUBLIC DATA STRUCTURES ***
00327 *****************************/
00328 /* Buffers for outgoing packets. */
00329 extern u_char outpacket_buf[NUM_PPP][PPP_MRU+PPP_HDRLEN];
00330 
00331 extern struct ppp_settings ppp_settings;
00332 
00333 extern struct protent *ppp_protocols[];/* Table of pointers to supported protocols */

00336 /***********************
00337 *** PUBLIC FUNCTIONS ***
00338 ***********************/
00339 
00340 /* Initialize the PPP subsystem. */
00341 void pppInit(void);
00342 
00343 void pppSetAuth(const char *user, const char *passwd);
00344 
00345 /*
00346  * Open a new PPP connection using the given I/O device.
00347  * This initializes the PPP control block but does not
00348  * attempt to negotiate the LCP session.
00349  * Return a new PPP connection descriptor on success or
00350  * an error code (negative) on failure. 
00351  */
00352 int pppOpen(sio_fd_t fd, void (*linkStatusCB)(void *ctx, int errCode, void *arg), void *linkStatusCtx);
00353 
00354 /*
00355  * Close a PPP connection and release the descriptor. 
00356  * Any outstanding packets in the queues are dropped.
00357  * Return 0 on success, an error code on failure. 
00358  */
00359 int pppClose(int pd);
00360 
00361 /*
00362  * Indicate to the PPP process that the line has disconnected.
00363  */
00364 void pppSigHUP(int pd);
00365 
00366 /*
00367  * Get and set parameters for the given connection.
00368  * Return 0 on success, an error code on failure. 
00369  */
00370 int  pppIOCtl(int pd, int cmd, void *arg);
00371 
00372 /*
00373  * Return the Maximum Transmission Unit for the given PPP connection.
00374  */
00375 u_int pppMTU(int pd);
00376 
00377 /*
00378  * Write n characters to a ppp link.
00379  *      RETURN: >= 0 Number of characters written
00380  *                       -1 Failed to write to device
00381  */
00382 int pppWrite(int pd, const u_char *s, int n);
00383 
00384 void pppMainWakeup(int pd);
00385 
00386 /* Configure i/f transmit parameters */
00387 void ppp_send_config (int, int, u32_t, int, int);
00388 /* Set extended transmit ACCM */
00389 void ppp_set_xaccm (int, ext_accm *);
00390 /* Configure i/f receive parameters */
00391 void ppp_recv_config (int, int, u32_t, int, int);
00392 /* Find out how long link has been idle */
00393 int  get_idle_time (int, struct ppp_idle *);
00394 
00395 /* Configure VJ TCP header compression */
00396 int  sifvjcomp (int, int, int, int);
00397 /* Configure i/f down (for IP) */
00398 int  sifup (int);               
00399 /* Set mode for handling packets for proto */
00400 int  sifnpmode (int u, int proto, enum NPmode mode);
00401 /* Configure i/f down (for IP) */
00402 int  sifdown (int);     
00403 /* Configure IP addresses for i/f */
00404 int  sifaddr (int, u32_t, u32_t, u32_t, u32_t, u32_t);
00405 /* Reset i/f IP addresses */
00406 int  cifaddr (int, u32_t, u32_t);
00407 /* Create default route through i/f */
00408 int  sifdefaultroute (int, u32_t, u32_t);
00409 /* Delete default route through i/f */
00410 int  cifdefaultroute (int, u32_t, u32_t);
00411 
00412 /* Get appropriate netmask for address */
00413 u32_t GetMask (u32_t); 
00414 
00415 #endif /* PPP_SUPPORT */
00416 
00417 #endif /* PPP_H */
